definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
Cyrus the Great (ca. 600-530 BC), the founder of the Persian Empire and the conqueror of Babylon

sentences.english: And Daniel continued even unto the first year of king Cyrus.
sentences.chinese: 到居鲁士王元年，但以理还在。

sentences.english: But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.
sentences.chinese: 然而巴比伦王居鲁士元年，他降旨允准建造神的这殿。
居鲁士就这样宣布了这个命令。

sentences.english: The empire was forged by Cyrus the Great, andspanned three continents: Asia, Africa and Europe.
sentences.chinese: 帝国由居鲁士大帝建立，横跨亚非欧三大洲。

sentences.english: And Daniel continued even to the first year of king Cyrus.
sentences.chinese: 达尼尔就这样一直到居鲁士王元年。

definition: Cyrus the Great (ca. 600-530 BC), the founder of the Persian Empire and the conqueror of Babylon

pinyin: Ya4 li4 shan1 da4 Da4 di4

definition: Thebes, place name in ancient Egypt/Thebes, ancient Greek city state
